intro: Ischarum nobile, commonly known as the noble ischa, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and alpine regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to cold, harsh environments. Its flowers are usually white or pale purple, and it produces small, round pods that contain seeds. Ischarum nobile is often found in tundra and mountainous habitats where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local ecosystems.
